Package com.pixelduke.transit

Class JMetroStyleClass

extends java.lang.Object

  • Field Details

    • BACKGROUND

      public static final java.lang.String BACKGROUND
      StyleClass that defines a node as a background. Its color will change according to whether JMetro is set with Style.LIGHT or Style.DARK. You should use this in any Pane that is a background in your application.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • UNDERLINE_TAB_PANE

      public static final java.lang.String UNDERLINE_TAB_PANE
      StyleClass that defines a new alternate style for TabPanes. Add this styleclass to a TabPane and it will show an alternate style where the selected tab has an underline.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • LIGHT_BUTTONS

      public static final java.lang.String LIGHT_BUTTONS
      StyleClass that defines an alternate style for Buttons, ToggleButtons, MenuButtons and SplitMenuButtons. With this style these controls look less prominent and more integrated with their container (for instance, they don't show a border around them).
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • ALTERNATING_ROW_COLORS

      public static final java.lang.String ALTERNATING_ROW_COLORS
      StyleClass that defines an alternate style for TableView, TreeTableView, TreeView and ListViews. With this style these controls will have their rows with alternate colors (i.e. one color for even rows another color for odd rows). This has the advantage of increasing the legibility of these controls especially when this controls with cells are data heavy and with the control has a larger width.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • TABLE_GRID_LINES

      public static final java.lang.String TABLE_GRID_LINES
      Styleclass that adds grid lines to table like controls
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • JMetroStyleClass

      public JMetroStyleClass()

  • Method Details

    • addIfNotPresent

      public static void addIfNotPresent​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> collection, java.lang.String styleclass)
      Adds a style class to a List if it is not already there. The List is usually the styleClass collection of a JavaFX Node.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection of styleclasses
      styleclass - the styleclass to add
